statements: SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE satisfaction_score > 7;
SELECT feedback FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE employee_id = 12345;
SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey ORDER BY satisfaction_score DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_surveys FROM employee_satisfaction_survey;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, satisfaction_score, feedback FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE satisfaction_score > 3 ORDER BY satisfaction_score DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE employee_id = 1001
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, feedback FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE satisfaction_score < 3 ORDER BY survey_id DESC
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_satisfaction_survey WHERE feedback IS NOT NULL ORDER BY employee_id
SELECT satisfaction_score, COUNT(employee_id) AS num_employees FROM employee_satisfaction_survey GROUP BY satisfaction_score HAVING COUNT(employee_id) > 1
SELECT * FROM employee_survey WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_survey WHERE satisfaction_score > 80;
SELECT manager_name, department FROM employee_survey ORDER BY department DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_survey WHERE employee_id = 101 AND satisfaction_score < 60;
SELECT question_id, question_text FROM survey_questions;
SELECT * FROM employee_survey WHERE satisfaction_score > 80 ORDER BY department ASC, employee_id DESC;
SELECT department, manager_name, AVG(satisfaction_score) AS avg_score FROM employee_survey GROUP BY department, manager_name HAVING AVG(satisfaction_score) > 70;
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) AS num_employees FROM employee_survey GROUP BY department ORDER BY num_employees DESC;
SELECT e.department, e.manager_name, q.question_text FROM employee_survey e JOIN survey_questions q ON e.satisfaction_score < 50 WHERE e.department = 'HR' ORDER BY e.employee_id DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT e.department, s.question_text FROM employee_survey e, survey_questions s WHERE e.satisfaction_score BETWEEN 60 AND 80 ORDER BY e.department ASC, s.question_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_survey_data WHERE employee_id = 1
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score FROM employee_survey_data WHERE department = 'HR'
SELECT * FROM survey_responses WHERE survey_date = '2022-01-01'
SELECT response_text, survey_date FROM survey_responses WHERE question_id = 1
SELECT question_text, question_category FROM survey_questions
SELECT * FROM employee_survey_data ORDER BY satisfaction_score DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score, department FROM employee_survey_data WHERE department='HR'
SELECT response_id, question_text FROM survey_responses JOIN survey_questions ON survey_responses.question_id = survey_questions.question_id WHERE survey_date='2022-01-01'
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_score, department FROM employee_survey_data WHERE satisfaction_score > 3 ORDER BY department ASC
SELECT department, AVG(satisfaction_score) AS avg_satisfaction FROM employee_survey_data GROUP BY department
SELECT employee_name, satisfaction_score FROM Employee WHERE department='HR'
SELECT * FROM Department WHERE department_name='Finance'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM SurveyResponse WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, satisfaction_rating FROM Employee JOIN SurveyResponse ON Employee.employee_id = SurveyResponse.employee_id
SELECT analysis_id, analysis_date, analysis_description FROM FeedbackAnalysis
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE satisfaction_score > 80
SELECT department, COUNT(employee_id) AS num_employees FROM Employee GROUP BY department

SELECT e.employee_name, d.department_name, s.satisfaction_rating, fa.analysis_description FROM Employee e JOIN Department d ON e.department = d.department_name JOIN SurveyResponse s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id JOIN FeedbackAnalysis fa ON fa.analysis_id = 1

SELECT e.employee_name, s.survey_date, s.satisfaction_rating, s.feedback FROM Employee e INNER JOIN SurveyResponse s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.department = 'Sales' ORDER BY s.survey_date DESC

SELECT e.employee_name, e.department, AVG(s.satisfaction_rating) AS avg_rating FROM Employee e INNER JOIN SurveyResponse s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id GROUP BY e.employee_name, e.department HAVING avg_rating > 75
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurvey;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_level FROM EmployeeSurvey WHERE satisfaction_level > 4.5;
SELECT department, AVG(satisfaction_level) AS avg_satisfaction FROM EmployeeSurvey GROUP BY department;
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, d.department_name FROM Employees e JOIN Departments d ON e.department = d.department_name;
SELECT q.question_text, r.answer FROM SurveyQuestions q JOIN SurveyResponses r ON q.question_id = r.question_id;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurvey WHERE satisfaction_level > 0.5 ORDER BY department ASC;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM Employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT question_text FROM SurveyQuestions WHERE LENGTH(question_text) > 50;
SELECT employee_id, AVG(satisfaction_level) AS avg_satisfaction FROM EmployeeSurvey GROUP BY employee_id;
SELECT department_name, COUNT(*) AS employee_count FROM Employees INNER JOIN Departments ON Employees.department = Departments.department_name GROUP BY department_name;
